result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy P. LeBoeuf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $13,183.00 plus surcharges.  Joint & Severally w/ co-deft.
May not have contact with Southport Bank, BMO Harris Bank and State Bank of the Lakes, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:05pm-  Victim rights compliance.  
Count 1-  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 10 years w/conditions - consecutive to count 2.
Count 2-  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 17 years: 9 years initial confinement & 8 years extended supervision w/ conditions.  Credit for 220 days.
Count 3-  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 10 years w/conditions - consecutive to count 2.
Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge on each count.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $13,183.00 - joint & several w/ co-defendant.  Appeal rights given.
from DE    (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Perz on 6/10/2015)
$25,000 signiture bond revoked.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:28pm-  Matter heard with 14CF1453.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1-3; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  BOND REVOKED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Copy of certified court record given to deputy.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:53am-  Matter heard with 14CF1453.  Attorney Perz is requesting an adjournment to allow him time to continue discussions w/ DDA Graveley.  Matter is close to a resolution.  Court grants request.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Bond continued.
atty: M Perz
atty: M Perz

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-1-15 @ 10:30am with co-def. and def.'s other cases. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

1:44  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz. Clerk LE.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  4-21-15 @ 10:15 am  $25,000.00 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*No Contact w/ TCF National Bank, State Bank of the Lakes, BMO Harris Bank, Jessica N. C or her residence.
